channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The U.S. job market cooled as Trump's trade war heated up
item.description: U.S. employers added 177,000 jobs in April — a modest slowdown from the previous month, while the unemployment rate held steady at 4.2%.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. employers added 177,000 jobs in April — a modest slowdown from the previous month, while the unemployment rate held steady at 4.2%.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Trump orders end of NPR's federal funding. And, judge blocks use of Alien Enemies Act
item.description: Trump signed an executive order to end federal funding for NPR and PBS, accusing the organizations of political bias. And, a federal judge ruled Trump's usage of the Alien Enemies Act was unlawful.
item.content:encoded:
Trump signed an executive order to end federal funding for NPR and PBS, accusing the organizations of political bias. And, a federal judge ruled Trump's usage of the Alien Enemies Act was unlawful.

(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Which celebrity was allegedly robbed by the elderly? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week, we're light on popes and presidents — but if you've been keeping up with the Kardashians, you'll get at least one question right.
item.content:encoded: This week, we're light on popes and presidents — but if you've been keeping up with the Kardashians, you'll get at least one question right.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Gorillas have a big fight ahead of them, and it's not against 100 men, expert says
item.description: This week, the internet was up in arms over who would win in battle: 100 men or a single silverback gorilla? One expert says the real fight is much bigger.
item.content:encoded:
This week, the internet was up in arms over who would win in battle: 100 men or a single silverback gorilla? One expert says the real fight is much bigger.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Inside the glitz and glamor of the Kentucky Derby
item.description: Hats, horses and high rollers. These are just some of the things that add to the atmosphere of Churchill Downs on Derby Day.
item.content:encoded:
Hats, horses and high rollers. These are just some of the things that add to the atmosphere of Churchill Downs on Derby Day.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Bipartisan push to ban lawmakers from trading stocks gets boost from Trump
item.description: Proposals to bar members of Congress from trading stocks have stalled for years. But President Trump's public support of the idea, along with the endorsement of a top Democrat could change the dynamic.
item.content:encoded:
Proposals to bar members of Congress from trading stocks have stalled for years. But President Trump's public support of the idea, along with the endorsement of a top Democrat could change the dynamic.

(Image credit: BRYAN R. SMITH/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: Shein and Temu will cost more, thanks to massive tariffs going into effect
item.description: Shein and Temu goods might not be so cheap anymore. Starting today, the U.S. will start collecting import fees on small packages from China, much of which comes from Chinese e-commerce sites.
item.content:encoded:
Shein and Temu goods might not be so cheap anymore. Starting today, the U.S. will start collecting import fees on small packages from China, much of which comes from Chinese e-commerce sites.

(Image credit: KIRILL KUDRYAVTSEV)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: 'Breakfast on the Bridges': a monthly Portland commuter tradition
item.description: On the last Friday of the month, a group of volunteers serves up tasty treats to morning bike commuters and passersby. The event has been going on for over 20 years.
item.content:encoded:
On the last Friday of the month, a group of volunteers serves up tasty treats to morning bike commuters and passersby. The event has been going on for over 20 years.

(Image credit: Celeste Noche)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Asian American voters backed Trump in Nevada. Here's how they feel about him now
item.description: After backing Joe Biden in 2020, Asian American voters in Nevada swung decisively toward Donald Trump in 2024. Now, they reflect on how his presidency is going so far.
item.content:encoded:
After backing Joe Biden in 2020, Asian American voters in Nevada swung decisively toward Donald Trump in 2024. Now, they reflect on how his presidency is going so far.

(Image credit: David Becker)
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: How tariffs might impact small American winemakers
item.description: President Trump's new tariffs could help the American wine industry by making wines from abroad more expensive. But some smaller American winemakers aren't feeling as positive about them.
item.content:encoded: President Trump's new tariffs could help the American wine industry by making wines from abroad more expensive. But some smaller American winemakers aren't feeling as positive about them.
item.dc:creator: Willa Rubin
